title: Week 2 - Programming in Base R
text:
pre_bp <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)
pre_bp

 [1] 120 151 125 126 115 132 132 129 134 139 127 122 127 135 133 128 147 138 140
[20] 132

post_bp <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)
post_bp

 [1] 127 145 135 122 115 122 123 126 126 129 132 146 120 114 121 120 128 120 133
[20] 115






patient <- paste("Patient", 1:20, sep = "_")

names(pre_bp) <- paste("Patient", 1:20, sep = "_")
pre_bp

 Patient_1  Patient_2  Patient_3  Patient_4  Patient_5  Patient_6  Patient_7 
       120        151        125        126        115        132        132 
 Patient_8  Patient_9 Patient_10 Patient_11 Patient_12 Patient_13 Patient_14 
       129        134        139        127        122        127        135 
Patient_15 Patient_16 Patient_17 Patient_18 Patient_19 Patient_20 
       133        128        147        138        140        132 

names(post_bp) <- paste("Patient", 1:20, sep = "_")
post_bp

 Patient_1  Patient_2  Patient_3  Patient_4  Patient_5  Patient_6  Patient_7 
       127        145        135        122        115        122        123 
 Patient_8  Patient_9 Patient_10 Patient_11 Patient_12 Patient_13 Patient_14 
       126        126        129        132        146        120        114 
Patient_15 Patient_16 Patient_17 Patient_18 Patient_19 Patient_20 
       121        120        128        120        133        115 






diff_bp <- pre_bp - post_bp
diff_bp

 Patient_1  Patient_2  Patient_3  Patient_4  Patient_5  Patient_6  Patient_7 
        -7          6        -10          4          0         10          9 
 Patient_8  Patient_9 Patient_10 Patient_11 Patient_12 Patient_13 Patient_14 
         3          8         10         -5        -24          7         21 
Patient_15 Patient_16 Patient_17 Patient_18 Patient_19 Patient_20 
        12          8         19         18          7         17 






avg_bp_dec <- mean(diff_bp)
avg_bp_dec

[1] 5.65






patient_bp_dec <- which(diff_bp > 0)
names(patient_bp_dec)

 [1] "Patient_2"  "Patient_4"  "Patient_6"  "Patient_7"  "Patient_8" 
 [6] "Patient_9"  "Patient_10" "Patient_13" "Patient_14" "Patient_15"
[11] "Patient_16" "Patient_17" "Patient_18" "Patient_19" "Patient_20"

patient_bp_dec

 Patient_2  Patient_4  Patient_6  Patient_7  Patient_8  Patient_9 Patient_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Patient_13 Patient_14 Patient_15 Patient_16 Patient_17 Patient_18 Patient_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Patient_20 
        20 






ss_pos_change <- diff_bp[diff_bp > 0]
ss_pos_change

 Patient_2  Patient_4  Patient_6  Patient_7  Patient_8  Patient_9 Patient_10 
         6          4         10          9          3          8         10 
Patient_13 Patient_14 Patient_15 Patient_16 Patient_17 Patient_18 Patient_19 
         7         21         12          8         19         18          7 
Patient_20 
        17 






avg_dec_in_bp <- mean(ss_pos_change)
avg_dec_in_bp

[1] 10.6

title: Week 2 - Programming in Base R
text:
Task 2: Basic Data Frame Practice

1. Created data frame referencing data from task 1

patient <- 1:20
pre_bp 

 Patient_1  Patient_2  Patient_3  Patient_4  Patient_5  Patient_6  Patient_7 
       120        151        125        126        115        132        132 
 Patient_8  Patient_9 Patient_10 Patient_11 Patient_12 Patient_13 Patient_14 
       129        134        139        127        122        127        135 
Patient_15 Patient_16 Patient_17 Patient_18 Patient_19 Patient_20 
       133        128        147        138        140        132 

post_bp

 Patient_1  Patient_2  Patient_3  Patient_4  Patient_5  Patient_6  Patient_7 
       127        145        135        122        115        122        123 
 Patient_8  Patient_9 Patient_10 Patient_11 Patient_12 Patient_13 Patient_14 
       126        126        129        132        146        120        114 
Patient_15 Patient_16 Patient_17 Patient_18 Patient_19 Patient_20 
       121        120        128        120        133        115 

diff_bp

 Patient_1  Patient_2  Patient_3  Patient_4  Patient_5  Patient_6  Patient_7 
        -7          6        -10          4          0         10          9 
 Patient_8  Patient_9 Patient_10 Patient_11 Patient_12 Patient_13 Patient_14 
         3          8         10         -5        -24          7         21 
Patient_15 Patient_16 Patient_17 Patient_18 Patient_19 Patient_20 
        12          8         19         18          7         17 

r_df <- data.frame(patient, pre_bp, post_bp, diff_bp)
r_df

           patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
Patient_1        1    120     127      -7
Patient_2        2    151     145       6
Patient_3        3    125     135     -10
Patient_4        4    126     122       4
Patient_5        5    115     115       0
Patient_6        6    132     122      10
Patient_7        7    132     123       9
Patient_8        8    129     126       3
Patient_9        9    134     126       8
Patient_10      10    139     129      10
Patient_11      11    127     132      -5
Patient_12      12    122     146     -24
Patient_13      13    127     120       7
Patient_14      14    135     114      21
Patient_15      15    133     121      12
Patient_16      16    128     120       8
Patient_17      17    147     128      19
Patient_18      18    138     120      18
Patient_19      19    140     133       7
Patient_20      20    132     115      17




2. Returned only rows of the data where diff_bp is negative by subsetting

diff_bp_neg <- subset(patient, diff_bp < 0)
diff_bp_neg

[1]  1  3 11 12




3. Added a new column to data frame corresponding to TRUE if post_bp is less than 120 and FALSE if not

r_df$post_bp

 [1] 127 145 135 122 115 122 123 126 126 129 132 146 120 114 121 120 128 120 133
[20] 115

r_df$post_bp120 <- r_df$post_bp < 120
r_df

           patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp post_bp120

Patient_2        2    151     145       6      FALSE
Patient_3        3    125     135     -10      FALSE

Patient_9        9    134     126       8      FALSE
Patient_10      10    139     129      10      FALSE
Patient_11      11    127     132      -5      FALSE
Patient_12      12    122     146     -24      FALSE
Patient_13      13    127     120       7      FALSE
Patient_14      14    135     114      21       TRUE
Patient_15      15    133     121      12      FALSE
Patient_16      16    128     120       8      FALSE
Patient_17      17    147     128      19      FALSE
Patient_18      18    138     120      18      FALSE
Patient_19      19    140     133       7      FALSE

title: Week 2 - Programming in Base R
text:
Task 3: List Practice

1. Created a new data frame with new values, looking similar to data frame from task 2 (including new T/F values)

patient <- 1:10
pre_plcbo <- c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130)
post_plcbo <- c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120, 124)
diff_plcbo <- pre_plcbo - post_plcbo

plcbo_df <- data.frame(patient, pre_plcbo, post_plcbo, diff_plcbo)
plcbo_df$post_plcbo120 <- plcbo_df$post_plcbo < 120
plcbo_df

   patient pre_plcbo post_plcbo diff_plcbo post_plcbo120
1        1       138        105         33          TRUE
2        2       135        136         -1         FALSE
3        3       147        123         24         FALSE
4        4       117        130        -13         FALSE
5        5       152        134         18         FALSE
6        6       134        143         -9         FALSE
7        7       114        135        -21         FALSE
8        8       121        139        -18         FALSE
9        9       131        120         11         FALSE
10      10       130        124          6         FALSE




2. Created and stored a list with 2 elements (1st element = treatment, 2nd element = placebo)

treatment <- r_df
placebo <- plcbo_df
list3 <- list(treatment = treatment, placebo = placebo)
list3

$treatment
           patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp post_bp120
Patient_1        1    120     127      -7      FALSE
Patient_2        2    151     145       6      FALSE
Patient_3        3    125     135     -10      FALSE
Patient_4        4    126     122       4      FALSE
Patient_5        5    115     115       0       TRUE
Patient_6        6    132     122      10      FALSE
Patient_7        7    132     123       9      FALSE
Patient_8        8    129     126       3      FALSE
Patient_9        9    134     126       8      FALSE
Patient_10      10    139     129      10      FALSE
Patient_11      11    127     132      -5      FALSE
Patient_12      12    122     146     -24      FALSE
Patient_13      13    127     120       7      FALSE
Patient_14      14    135     114      21       TRUE
Patient_15      15    133     121      12      FALSE
Patient_16      16    128     120       8      FALSE
Patient_17      17    147     128      19      FALSE
Patient_18      18    138     120      18      FALSE
Patient_19      19    140     133       7      FALSE
Patient_20      20    132     115      17       TRUE

$placebo
   patient pre_plcbo post_plcbo diff_plcbo post_plcbo120
1        1       138        105         33          TRUE
2        2       135        136         -1         FALSE
3        3       147        123         24         FALSE
4        4       117        130        -13         FALSE
5        5       152        134         18         FALSE
6        6       134        143         -9         FALSE
7        7       114        135        -21         FALSE
8        8       121        139        -18         FALSE
9        9       131        120         11         FALSE
10      10       130        124          6         FALSE




3. Accessed only the 1st list using 3 different types of syntax: $, [], and [[]]

example1 <- list3$treatment
example1

           patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp post_bp120
Patient_1        1    120     127      -7      FALSE
Patient_2        2    151     145       6      FALSE
Patient_3        3    125     135     -10      FALSE
Patient_4        4    126     122       4      FALSE
Patient_5        5    115     115       0       TRUE
Patient_6        6    132     122      10      FALSE
Patient_7        7    132     123       9      FALSE
Patient_8        8    129     126       3      FALSE
Patient_9        9    134     126       8      FALSE
Patient_10      10    139     129      10      FALSE
Patient_11      11    127     132      -5      FALSE

Patient_13      13    127     120       7      FALSE
Patient_14      14    135     114      21       TRUE

Patient_17      17    147     128      19      FALSE
Patient_18      18    138     120      18      FALSE
Patient_19      19    140     133       7      FALSE
Patient_20      20    132     115      17       TRUE



bracket <- list3[1]
bracket

$treatment
           patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp post_bp120

Patient_3        3    125     135     -10      FALSE

Patient_20      20    132     115      17       TRUE




4. Used 1 line of code to access the pre_bp (actually referred to as “pre_plcbo”) column of the placebo frame (2nd element)

list3$placebo$pre_plcbo

 [1] 138 135 147 117 152 134 114 121 131 130
